alert.note: Alert for Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 13 at 5:18PM ChST until January 14 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CHST SATURDAY... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM SATURDAY TO 6 PM SUNDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of 12 to 16 feet and dangerous rip currents expected along north and east facing reefs. * WHERE...For the High Surf Warning, along north-facing reefs Tinian and Saipan. For the High Surf Advisory and the High Rip Current Risk, north- and east-facing reefs. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, until 6 PM ChST Saturday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 6 PM Saturday to 6 PM ChST Sunday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tinian and Saipan will continue to incur the biggest impact from the large northeast swell. Tanapag buoy reported maximum wave heights of 20 to 30 feet. Swell is expected to turn more from the east and gradually subside Saturday afternoon into evening, downgrading to an advisory and be extended to east- facing reefs when the warning expires.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
